definition[0]: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
definition[3]: a reddish-brown metal used, among other things, for making wire and CABLEs
example[1]: On Friday, copper for March delivery ended at 98.9 cents a pound, up 1.9 cents.
example[2]: The company is a major producer of copper products.
definition[4]: coins of low value made of copper or other dark-coloured metals
example[3]: He counted out three pounds, all in coppers.
